name: Mercury
description: The smallest and closest planet to the Sun. Mercury's surface is heavily cratered, similar to the Moon. It has no significant atmosphere to retain heat, so its surface temperature varies greatly between day and night.

name: Venus
description: The hottest planet with a dense atmosphere, mainly carbon dioxide, creating an extreme greenhouse effect. Venus's surface is obscured by thick clouds of sulfuric acid.

name: Earth
description: Our planet and the only place in the Solar System known to harbor life. Earth has a diverse atmosphere, liquid water oceans, and active tectonic plates.

name: Mars
description: Known as the 'Red Planet' due to iron oxide on its surface. Mars has diverse terrain, including volcanoes, valleys, deserts, and polar ice caps. There is evidence that Mars once had liquid water.

name: Jupiter
description: The largest planet in the Solar System, a gas giant. Jupiter has the Great Red Spot, a giant storm larger than Earth, and a very strong magnetic field.

name: Saturn
description: Famous for its spectacular ring system, made up of billions of ice and rock particles. Saturn is also a gas giant, similar to Jupiter.

name: Uranus
description: A pale blue gas giant, due to the presence of methane in its atmosphere. Uranus has a faint ring system and rotates at a very large angle to the plane of its orbit.

name: Neptune
description: The farthest planet in the Solar System, also a blue gas giant. Neptune has the strongest winds in the Solar System and a faint ring system.
discoverer: Urbain Le Verrier, John Couch Adams, Johann Galle (1846)

name: Moon
description: Earth's only natural satellite. The Moon's surface is heavily cratered, with mountains and maria (dark areas).

name: Asteroid Belt
description: A belt containing countless small celestial bodies, mainly rock and metal, located between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.

name: Kuiper Belt
description: A region beyond Neptune's orbit, containing many small icy bodies, remnants from the Solar System's formation. It is similar to the asteroid belt but much larger and more massive.
